newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila sees $10-$15 bln revenue from gas project.
newsitem.headline: Manila sees $10-$15 bln revenue from gas project.

text.p: The Philippine government expects to earn $10 billion to $15 billion in revenues over a period of 20 years from the first commercial gas find in the country, Shell Philippines Exploration B.V. (Spex) said on Monday.
Spex, a unit of the Royal Dutch Shell Group and Occidental Philippines, a unit of Occidental Petroleum Corp are the service contractors of the Camago-Malampaya gas field in southwest Philippines.

Reinier Willems, chief executive officer of the Shell group of companies in the Philippines, told reporters that one well in the Camago-Malampaya field is scheduled for drilling next year and another two in 1998.
The Department of Energy said that under the service contract scheme, the government is entitled to 60 percent of the net proceeds of a producing well.

The field which has recoverable reserves of 2.5 trillion cubic feet will have enough output to supply the daily requirement of a 3,000-megawatt power plant. The field will be ready for commercial operation by the year 2001.
